text: okay okay okay okay hi everyone Bethany
review Tano here the internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for a review of
this new shame album food for worms this
is the third full-length LP from UK Rock
upstarts shame who have matured quite a
bit since the release of their breakout
2018 album songs of praise which for me
felt more or less like some boilerplate
Post Punk that didn't have a whole lot
of distinct qualities to it but for sure
the band showed a lot of growth in
maturity versatility and performance
chemistry on the following drunk tank
pink a few years later so while shame
has certainly proven themselves to be a
very solid band I kind of went into this
LP hoping to hear them formulate
something that felt uh or sounded a bit
more specific to them and at least some
of the teaser material show that we'd be
in for something different like the
track six pack for example which at its
core I think is a post-punk tune but
throughout much of the track you had
this fiery kind of Psych or hard rock
riff that you typically don't hear
Blended with these kinds of vocals and
drums there are multiple phases the
track moves through a really climactic
finish where that main riff comes back
and most interestingly the lyrics come
across like this David byrne-esque
diatribe about things happening in this
room or the outside world there are a
lot of nods in the lyrics toward things
like self-improvement and Fantastical
desires so while this track was cool I
didn't really find the rest of the album
to be as daring in comparison though
there are other tracks that show the
band continuing to expand their
stylistic palette Adderall for example
which I think is the best ballad the
band has ever laid to tape not only in
terms of Dynamics progression and
harmonious layers of guitars and
background vocals but it's a moving
piece of musical Outreach about somebody
who is falling prey to an addiction or a
substance dependency and genuinely
wanting better for that person in a way
that doesn't come across preachy or
judgmental then the fall of Paul is a
genuinely good noise Rock rager the
chaotic flurry of drums and riffs on the
verses are already something to cold but
then the band goes Full Throttle into
these walls of distortion and feedback
along with much more authoritative
vocals that are hit with these tight
splashes of delay this track to me is a
master class in tension and release the
band is sounding tighter than they ever
have and you can really tell in this
recording that the band tracked and put
this record together in a super organic
fashion so while yeah these tracks are
highlights they're cool there are some
newer moments in the record here that
don't hit quite as hard there's Orchid
which I think kind of sounds like a
deflated Smith song with all the Whimsy
sucked out of it though I suppose the
super heavy ending of the cut is pretty
cool there's the track Yankees too which
I also think is a bit of a standard
indie rock affair with a kind of
unlikely chord progression there's
almost pavement Vibes coming off of this
one for whatever reason I just think the
tune on this one doesn't stand out
however there are also spots on this
thing where the band is kind of resting
on their Post Punk Laurels and are still
digging up gold like the harmony his
intro fingers of Steel as well as Alibis
which I think has a standout chorus I
question that I question that I question
that the biggest letdown on the lp
honestly is the final leg of it where I
think the band hands out a couple of
relative Duds there's burning by Design
which is another heavy Rock ballad
packed with angst and tune wise I don't
think it's one of the stronger moments
here and there's almost a bit of meta
commentary on something along those
lines in the lyrics I don't care about
the songs that use these chords I'm sure
there's plenty more but I know they're
not the same and look as a reviewer I'm
not going to get bent out of shape over
some similar chord progressions between
songs it happens all the time but I
generally think there is something to
say about the lack of anything specific
melodically or aesthetically to this
track making it kind of just not have
that much of an impact it does feel
super dime a dozen even if I think
that's Speedy instrumental passage
toward the very end is a pretty neat
switch up I feel somewhat similarly
about the song different person I'm
impressed more by the culmination of
ideas and and influences on this track
as opposed to the song itself Eerie lead
vocals and danceable drums Nimble bass
lines and very haunting guitar arpeggios
make for a strange mix of Vibes it's
like creepy but I can also Groove to it
for sure it's got ferocity to it but I
was hoping for something sticky and
memorable to translate through the
cacophony as the song was moving along
and it just didn't really happen even as
the band switched up into some pretty
huge vocal Harmony passages as well as
this random bridge that only seems to
push the song further into disarray then
there's the closing track all the people
which I just think kneecaps itself with
a super sloppy performance while I
generally like the live and in the
moment feel of the songs on this LP it
gives the record a certain life feel
that you can't capture merely by
isolating and multi-tracking everything
individually and that intense in the
moment performance energy is enough for
me to overlook some of the muffled mixes
on this LP some of the sound bleed
during the louder moments but on this
closer I think this is the only moment
on the lp where recording the songs in
this way isn't to the track's benefit
because again the performance and
general sound of this one is pretty
messy which hinders this song that I
think is trying to come across as a
ballad or a more tender moment on the lp
even if it's trying to convey these
feelings of dejection and I don't know
give a little slacker indie rock chic I
suppose at least the closing Sentiments
of the album are positive all the people
that you're going to meet don't you
throw it all away because you can't love
yourself which frankly I think is pretty
Sound Advice even if it doesn't have the
strongest musical platform to stand on
but still for shame I would say this is
their best and most consistent album so
far their best crop of songs so far
their most explosive performances so far
but even at this point I think the band
is missing a little bit of something but
the versatility generally Great
Performances and good songwriting much
of the time do a lot to close that Gap
making this one of the better Punk and
Indie Centric records you're probably
going to hear this here I'm feeling a
decent seven on this one transition have
you given this album a listen did you
love it did you hate it what would you
rate it you're the best you're the best
what should I review next hit the like
if you like Please Subscribe and please
don't cry hit the Bell as well over here
next to my head is another video you can
check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel Anthony fantano
shame of forever
